dogecoin.text: 8/ By comparison, #DigiByte with its 15s block times is actually faster than #Dogecoin with lower transaction fees. More importantly, its supply is capped at 21 Billion which will be reached in 2035. Once reached no more DigiByte will ever be created.

7/ This makes #Dogecoin an excellent recreation of the system of Quantitive Easing that #Bitcoin was invented to replace. If you hold #DOGE its value is constantly being eroded by the continuous inflation of the supply. Money printer go brrrr, indeed.

6/ The cap of 10K #Dogecoin per block means that with Dogecoin's block time set at one minute, approximately 5 Billion #DOGE will enter circulation every year. This means there is no limit to the total number of #Dogecoin that can ever be created.

3/ The decision not to implement a supply cap at 100B coins was a specific decision made by #Dogecoin's creator,
Jackson Palmer back in 2014:
"Based on everyone’s feedback, we’ve decided to leave the Dogecoin code base as it was originally released, & not implement a change."

2/ For comparison, there is currently just over 18.5 million #Bitcoin (#BTC) in circulation. #Dogecoin has no limit on how many can ever be created. Bitcoin has a hard cap of 21 million, with the cryptocurrency predicted to hit this by 2140.

1/ As of August 2021, there are over 130 billion #Dogecoin in circulation according to @CoinMarketCap, The total market cap is currently over $31 billion. No other coin has a supply this large. The closest is #Stellar (#XLM), with a supply of 105 billion.

Cast your votes for your fav #UTXO #blockchain! 🗳
